website_summaries.verdict: From the durable, easy-to-grip case to the child-centered technology, this is a great model for kids. If you are looking for a tablet for a youngster, the HD 8 Kids Edition Fire is the one to get.
pros: The Kid's version of the popular Fire Tablet line that's been updated to include 400 GB expandable storage and dual-band WiFi
Comes with a rugged kid-friendly case
Has parental controls and access to the FreeTime app
Available in pink, yellow, or blue
cons: Some parents found the home screen interface less user-friendly than previous gen models
A bit challenging to set up
Some faulty tablets had various issues after being used for several months

customer_reviews.title: WIN WIN SITUATION!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 year old daughter, she loves it. I love it because, I have my cell phone back..
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by "Kids Edition"
customer_reviews.text: This is just a regular Amazon Fire Tablet with a kids app and protective case. If you already own a Fire tablet with a protective case, just subscribe to Freetime. It's much cheaper this way. We purchased this tablet as a birthday gift only to find out that it's a regular tablet with an app. Once you turn on the tablet, it defaults to all normal tablet settings and you have have to select the free time app for your child. IT DOES NOT DEFAULT to the free time settings. This was told to me directly from Tech support, after we purchased the tablet. So very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Brien

customer_reviews.title: Not up to par. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a tablet that was easy for kids to navigate. This happens. Every. Single. Day.
customer_reviews.author: K.M

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for a 3, 4, and 5 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my grandson on his 5th birthday. He had an older model, so he knew exactly what to do and how to use it! He was VERY happy and excited! He takes his tablet on all car trips, long and short, and plays in the evening just before bedtime, after homework and chores. His older brother will be getting one also for his 7th birthday next month.
customer_reviews.author: CLA

customer_reviews.title: Free time app update is Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Amazon recently released a new update for the Free time app for kids, it’s horrible!!! It just keeps freezing all the time now and my kids get error messages that require us to restart the whole tablet to get it to come off multiple times a day. What a joke amazon you need to fix this ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Jacquie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold a charge!
customer_reviews.text: The first tablet I ordered was great but this one won’t hold a charge keeps going dead. I don’t know if I would recommend this tablet because he has to keep it on the charger while playing with it and that’s very dangerous for a 4 year old kid. Contacted amazon and they kept me on hold for almost 20 mins so I hung up!
customer_reviews.author: Shalonda Thompson

customer_reviews.title: HD kid Edition/DIAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Kindle 8 Kids Edition for my twin grandchildren. I was overjoyed to see them light up with delight when they received them. However, now they're having problems connecting to Free Time Unlimited and ERROR'S are popping up while strolling through their Apps. I can't explain how disappointed and frustrated they've been. Spoke to Amazon tec support and got the run around.
customer_reviews.author: Jporter

customer_reviews.title: Product is at your own risk. May get a dud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids for Christmas. Ended up giving it to them early. And the tablet is completely blacked out and won't charge. It's completely dead right out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: two for one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the tablet for my oldest grandson, he loves it, the only problem I have is, the settings were preset with all of my information and credit card information. I thought my daughter set the tablet up, and placed a parental block, but she did not, and my youngest grandson got ahold of the tablet and downloaded app that cost money, I end up having to call my daughter and make her aware, she deleted my information and is setting a block, I spoke with two agents at amazon, I do not remember their names, but were very understanding, walked me though the entire process.
customer_reviews.author: mary smiley

customer_reviews.title: REGRETTING my purchase BIG TIME
customer_reviews.text: This is the WORST, slowest and most confusing device I have ever used. It is a kid friendly but not even a college educated adult can figure out how to use it. I wish I could explain in detail what features makes this tablet so hard to use - from the home screen, to the expired downloads and items available without Internet - I STRUGGLE greatly to seamlessly use it and regret greatly that I didn’t buy an old fire or iPad instead. Unfortunately I bought two for each of my kids so we are stuck with this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Angela E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet but poor parental controls and interface.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet itself performs admirably for its modest price. The parental controls and user interface leave much to be desired. Very poor design and lacking in any useful controls. No ability to lock the tablet in a single app. It needs something much more user friendly. Also the lack of support for my own content like movies and music outside of the amazon universe is also very frustrating. To load a dvd from my computer on to the tablet is nothing short of an adventure but then getting it to a place my child can find it to actually use is like Columbus finding the western world.
customer_reviews.author: Hammocl

customer_reviews.title: Shocked amazon makes such an inferior product
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these prior to the release in September but just gave them to our kids as early Christmas presents. Although I like the case and the size thats about all. We have had to restart both kindles multiple times per day when the kids are using them. The ‘oops something went wrong screen’ shows up frequently and generally we are very disappointed with all the ‘glitches’ that keep happening. Since our return window has passed we can’t return them. What a waste of $200! I would encourage others to spend more for an iPad or look around for alternatives. These things should be sold for a lot less with the quality being so poor.
customer_reviews.author: ashley dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: This, and all the kids kindles are junk. The software glitches and is difficult to work. SO MANY apps that you can't get rid of..ever. Even on the parents side it will download apps that you don't want on there. We had the Kindle 7 a few years ago and didn't care much for them. My son saved and bought the 8. We are returning it.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Error advertising built in stand ?
customer_reviews.text: My son already has the 7 and he loves it but I’m now ordering the 8 for him and my daughter. My thing is that in the description it’s advertising that the cases come with the built in stand but it does not show in the pictures that it does. I would very much like for amazon to correct this because now I will be expecting for my tablets to arrive with the built in stands and if this is in error on their part I hope they can correct their error with giving me the stand they advertised
customer_reviews.author: nancy esparza

customer_reviews.title: Clear picture
customer_reviews.text: I love it, picture very clear I love the size of the screen. Easy for my three year old to use
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money! I returned it immediately and got an iPad for my son instead!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst. Don’t waste your money! The screen has a bunch of suggested apps and stuff instead of the apps you actually want. You can’t hide or get rid of the suggested content and it takes up ALL of the home screen! If your kid clicks on the suggested items then it takes forever to download. The tablet is really slow and a complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Kid-Proof and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: My first review talked about problems with the offline options for this Kindle, which I'd bought for kids traveling. But support called me and walked me through performing a hard reset and manually updating the Freetime app, and after that everything worked perfectly, even after a week offline. I haven't had a lot of time to mess around with it, but it's kept the kids (1 and 3 years old) busy when we most needed it, so it's a win so far. I have a few games but they mostly enjoy the Prime and Netflix videos I've downloaded for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Toliver

customer_reviews.title: Durable & Fun
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tablet for toddlers and younger children. My three older children have the larger Fire HD 10 but our two year old couldn’t be trusted not to damage them. He now has his very own Fire HD Kids 8 and he absolutely loves it! Plus I don’t have to worry about him damaging it, the perimeter foam is very sturdy. Honestly I wish we had the kids version for our 4 year old too. The 8 is much more manageable in size too.
customer_reviews.author: PawlakMommy04

customer_reviews.title: software fixed
customer_reviews.text: Edit: software fixed, up to 4 stars Edit: Amazon contacted wanting to work with me and saying that a software fix will be coming. The rapid customer service is appreciated and have updated to 3 stars pending fix Bought 2, adding to host of other comments about daily “oops something went wrong” with very buggy software. This is in addition to very slow intermittent performance. Will update review when/if fixed but should not buy in current state.
customer_reviews.author: Jillie

customer_reviews.title: Pre ordered and glad i did.
customer_reviews.text: This slightly larger new model is the perfect size compared to the 7 or the 10. Love the fact that the battery lasts much longer than the old 7.
customer_reviews.author: 2nd HL

customer_reviews.title: Tech support - no bueno
customer_reviews.text: Keep getting "oops! Something went wrong" message and it shuts down. Tech support.....NIGHTMARE. NEVER AGAIN No storage, runs slow this is a real POS The 7 was way better than this JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old hates it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. It just downloads whatever they tap, filling up the memory. There are no descriptions of anything, it's just tiles of random apps, so you have no idea what it is until it's already installed on the device. I set up the parental control thing to make it so they have to surpass their reading goal before the games are available, but no, that doesn't work 9 times out of 10. The time limit seems to not work half the time either. It freezes constantly, and when it does work, takes forever to load. Freetime seems to just restart randomly. Apps disappear. I honestly regret buying it. He has more fun on our 6 year old ipad.
customer_reviews.author: DB Harp

customer_reviews.title: OOPS something went wrong
customer_reviews.text: Price was great and the Freetime for a year is great however every five minutes I have to restart the device because it says oops something went wrong? I have checked many pages and it seems like this is happening with almost all fire owners in some way or another. Yes my software is up to date and yes I’ve contacted Amazon who seems to be pretending they haven’t heard of this issue yet.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Genton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tablet for kiddos
customer_reviews.text: Switched from iPads to Fire tablets for my kids. I purchased two kids tablets that included the worry free warranty. It’s been heaven sent. I love how I can set a time limit on each tablet. Download kid friendly apps and learning apps. My daughter dropped her tablet today and broke the screen. I contacted customer service and with no questions asked They kindly ordered my replacement and provided me with a return label to return on my broken tablet. I highly recommend these for kids.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift for kids, my grandson (5) loves it. There are so many educational apps on it, they all come preloaded you just need to download the ones you want. It's really rugged and a great educational toy for them to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Older version was easier
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 Kindles in the Summer for my kids. They love them. The case is super durable and it's great for setting limitations while still having a device. I got this one, which I guess is an updated version for my brother who is special needs. I thought it was going to be perfect for him. He can't purchase things, listen to music, watch movies, play games....instead I am needing to contact customer support because it's not loading things and is difficult to use. I have even noticed that my daughter's has a different look that is harder to use, must be an update
customer_reviews.author: Sealy

customer_reviews.title: new tablet not so kid friendly
customer_reviews.text: ordered the 2 pack of tablets for the grand kids. One had the older software and one with the newer software which is not so kid friendly. Amazon could do nothing about it, but to return it very poor customer service. so we could return the old software tablet for the new software tablet and have 2 unfriendly kids tablets
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: Too much going on
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this Kindle but I felt like the Freetime had way to much stuff to offer that I felt like my son wasn't going to use. I couldn't remove so many suggested items from the main screen so the apps and downloads that he actually used got lost. Other than that the Kindle itself had a great screen, fast response time, and was very light for its size. I would have like to keep it but felt like I'd be paying for a lot of things we wouldn't use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A

customer_reviews.title: Wast of $$$
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon FreeTime unlimited for one year is a joke. After being on the phone with tech support for over an hour I found out in order to use the device to its full potential you need prime and willing to buy content. I would NOT recommend especially for anyone 4 and younger. The device also lags badly and the battery life goes quickly. Will be returning. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: FreeTime is taking a drink from a fire hose
customer_reviews.text: FreeTime app is aweful. Advertises that you have access to 20,000 games\books\whatever. What they don't say it's that it's preloaded in the app and to remove what you don't want you have to manually select each one. Even after you filter for age, this is thousands of items! I don't want 99% of the stuff on there! I'd rather select the stuff I do want.
customer_reviews.author: wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing idea done bad
customer_reviews.text: Very nice idea and I like free time app in general. But this is very very cheap tablets, so - it is very slow - not responsive - storage issues (with extension card even worse as you will have to trouble shoot it every other day, forget and reinstall sd card) - free time errors every day, some game do not download without providing any issue (most of the time it will say "please contact amazon support") in general kids love this but it requires too much time from parents to keep this device working.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Decent device, freetime needs a big overhaul...
customer_reviews.text: Crashes constantly so my kid has learned the old turn it off and back on, that's good I guess. Seems like a decent product for normal use but the freetime interface is pretty awful. Its noticeably slower than when in full access, and terribly organized. There's not even a real home screen where all the installed apps are. It's a lazy implementation of the interface from prime video and does not really translate well for a child's operating system. The row of recently used apps includes apps that were cancelled during the download. This is sloppy and there doesn't seem to be a way to remove them. I might be better off just showing them how to use full access.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: Laggy and touchy screen...
customer_reviews.text: Just got two for my babies, and I went through the setup. Really laggy and am very disappointed in the quality. Wouldn't have spent the money to be honest!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy W.

customer_reviews.title: great device!
customer_reviews.text: the only drawback we have is not being able to download youtube kids for the kid partition. other than that, i highly recommend it. ease of use is fantastic. kids love it. great display. case protects from most damage, i advise getting a screen protector although not so much for scratches but for cracks from naughty children
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: FreeTime keeps crashing
customer_reviews.text: FreeTime keeps crashing several times a day and getting error "oops something went wrong". Rebooting use to temporarily fix the issue, but that doesn't work anymore. The IT support is useless. Their only fix is to remove the child profile or reset the tablet.
customer_reviews.author: JP3002

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not as I expected
customer_reviews.text: The tablet itself works just fine. I'm only giving it two stars because of the garbage OS. It is NOT user friendly at all. The homepage is stuffed with garbage, most of which I didn't download for my child. It's all "recommended". Also, you would think that unlocking it with my parent code would give me a more access to customize the screen, downloaded programs, etc. If it does, I haven't figured it out yet. It's just CLUNKY at best.
customer_reviews.author: JHartranft

customer_reviews.title: Returned twice in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: First issue: The headphone jack was not working. I tried with 3 different headphones Second issue: The replacement did not come with the padding, neither the charging electric outlet adapter. They asked me to return everything to get a third replacement. I denied and asked for a refund. The tablet is slow. The screen is not vivid. The browser does not keep authentication (it does use a custom browser) hence painful to always have to log in on kid's websites because they need parents. Very poor quality overall it is not a good tablet. The price reflects what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Weak WiFi and not child friendly
customer_reviews.text: Oops there seems to be a problem seems to be a common error screen with these. I wish I knew before I purchased one for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Irvine

customer_reviews.title: Kid Approved!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this tablet as a potty training reward, it is working so beautifully. My kid loves playing on it because there are so many different games and books and she can use it to take photos. The parental controls have been super easy to use and the bed time control has made bed time easier as well because my kid is more excited about playing it the next day.
customer_reviews.author: B. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 yr old daughter loves this. For the price it works very well. No, it's not as fast as a new iPad, but our little one doesn't need the fastest device nor does she care. It plays kids games and videos fine. Netflix runs fine. The freetime app is great. Excellent battery life. Perfect for taking on them long car rides.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Do not install new update, will become useless
customer_reviews.text: Really wonderful when first started using. Was preparing for my sons birthday so I updated to the new OS. Once new OS installed, this became a brick. Very slow, doesn’t open any apps in Freetime.
customer_reviews.author: V. Sfakianoudis

customer_reviews.title: 2-Year Warranty is Fake!
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter broke this after a year so we tried to use the 2-year warranty which was a selling point for getting it. What a joke!!! Just a complete circle online stating to contact customer service but they give no contact information other than a mailing address. You have to send it to this address at your cost and never know what will actually happen once you do. Complete joke. The warranty is not intended to be honored else they would make the process clearer.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it. Wish they would have kept the control settings the same as previous models so it’s easier for kids to change profiles. Also wish the volume controls were different, kids have a hard time turning it up & down. Kids are 4 & 6 and they love having their own profile with the things they enjoy using that pops up when they use it. Takes a long time to charge but lasts a long time. Great for long car rides mounted in between the seats and volume through the car speakers
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon lacks the features apple has.
customer_reviews.text: Huge problem is with Amazon system. There is literally no way to restrict just purchases on their app store. So either the kid is constantly bringing me the tablet to enter my password just so they can download a free app or they are buying stuff that I then have to go through the process of returning if possible. Apple devices have a real simple way of restricting anything that requires money but still allowing the kids to download the free apps, but Amazon refuses to update their product for this. I think they want kids to make these 1.99 purchases knowing most people won't worry about refunding it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you have to
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I got this is for a young child to have a safe and easy to navigate tablet. Otherwise this tablet and the kindle fire operating system is a huge piece of dooky that I would pull every hair out of my head if I had to use it. It is laggy as hell. Battery drains just sitting. Uses micro USB. I have had ipads, Samsung tablets, and android phones since 2009. I am familiar with how a touch screen should operate and respond to touch. This misses the mark by a mile. I looked at this purchase as something that would fulfill a temporary need and then probably get thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: livingaboard

customer_reviews.title: I'm a little leery -- issue right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I know there is a 2 year warranty. But when setting up the tablet (directly out of the box) I went through a few steps, then got a screen that would say "Setting up your tablet - Just a sec!" -- But that "just a sec" turned into 4 hours. After 4 hours I contacted support and was told to do a reset on the tablet. Might not seem like a big deal... but this was my very first interaction with the tablet and it wasn't a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Soper

customer_reviews.title: A tablet to learn and have fun with.
customer_reviews.text: I do like the larger screen and the durability of the tablet cover, however, I don't like the fact that the tablet freezes whenever the child on it. A few times we had to shut down the tablet to get it to work. I would also like to remove somethings that may help the tablet work more effectively. Over the tablet is okay for my 8 year old. One more thing, I love the parent control that sets limits to tablet usage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: My child is technologically advanced. So I need something for her to use. So easy to use. It’s so worth it. The only downside is how easy the battery dies. Other than that it’s amazing
customer_reviews.author: Sarai

customer_reviews.title: Fixed software bug
customer_reviews.text: Had initially left a bad review due to a software issue, but amazon has since fixed the issue so I’m giving it a 4 star now.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I've been playing with the tablet a little more and finally figured things out. It's actually very user friendly and I like how it connects all of our Amazon items. My little one is able to easily navigate through apps. This is actually a nice tablet. I am still getting used to it. My son, 3 year's old, loves it. I like that it has all of the kid apps pre-programmed. We were able to download the new disney plus app but I had to do it using my profile. All in all it is a nice tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal H

customer_reviews.title: Bought for airplane
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tablet in hopes in would work on the airplane with the downloads (using no internet). It wouldn't connect for us to any free wi-fi at the airport without having a password. So for us, it was totally useless. It froze twice. I found myself having to press hard to get the touchscreen function working. We just ended up using the wifi on the plane with our phones when our toddler got antsy. Useless purchase for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica_Min

customer_reviews.title: Feel cheated on price change
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little tablet for kids, but it's inconvenient that youtube kids can't be downloaded onto the kids side, so our toddler has to use the "adult" version. We do really like the rubber case, it's very durable. The biggest disappointment is Amazon's policy. This is an Amazon product and they choose the pricing. We ordered this 3 weeks ago for $130 and now it's on sale for $90. I connected with an Amazon CSR and was advised that they do not price match at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad way to learn
customer_reviews.text: The Android interface is challenging and a bit slow sometimes. I like it mostly for the kids, though. There are some things that bother me about it. I don’t like having the Kindle’s set up with the Freetime account, which means that you can’t set parental controls for the content that they watch (unless it’s really deeply hidden.) This Kindle also has to be connected the internet to work. Our 7s did not have that issue, but many of the apps and downloads won’t work without the wifi. We do like the learning apps that work on this device. If you are interested in educational apps, there are lots of free and cheap ones that are compatible.
customer_reviews.author: laura157

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it zero stars
customer_reviews.text: Wont even work. Tells me I have the wrong time zone, um wtf!?! doesn't make sense. Try to go in and change the setting for time zone, then it defaults back to the other time zone after I try to use it again. Wont let my daughter on, saying screen time is over, its 8:30 in the morning. She hasn't even used it because I've been too busy trying to fix the time zone so it will even change to the correct time zone, which shouldn't be so difficult. Will be returning. WHAT A BUMMER!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining for the kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these (yellow & pink) for my granddaughters when their older ones broke. I think the original ones lasted a couple of years, maybe more. Surprised they lasted as long as they did, to be honest, as these girls were not gentle with them one iota despite repeated warnings. Typical of those under 5 years of age. Battery life doesn't seem to last very long, but that may be a good thing when you want to limit your LO's screen time. My oldest granddaughter taught herself how to read utilizing some of the children's games.
customer_reviews.author: LiLRedCV

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy-well made for little fellas and gals.
customer_reviews.text: My 23 month old grandson LOVES this YELLOW tablet. He had already tossed it across a hardwood floor in an angry fit and it remains intact! The only difficult part is that his manual dexterity isn't quite able to point and "drag" puzzle pieces that are in some of the educational games. His little fingers end up touching something else on the screen and it goes back to the menu-hence the occasional frustrated toss!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: An excellent tablet for kids!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Kindle for my 3 1/2 year old grandson. I appreciate how sturdy it is. It’s the perfect size for a young child’s hands. It only took him 5 minutes to figure it out and there are lots of apps, games, books, and videos he can choose from. The battery lasts all day too, a plus.
customer_reviews.author: RKM

customer_reviews.title: No child lock for touch screen
customer_reviews.text: So far the Kindle works great. My main complaint though is that there is no child lock to lock the touchscreen. I would have thought with something that supposedly made for kids it would be a way to play a video and lock the screen so that when they pound on it with their little fists they don't keep exiting out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Why does everyone like this thing?
customer_reviews.text: IDK why everyone loves this thing. It is difficult to use. It’s not user friendly or intuitive. You have to watch YouTube videos to work it. I though there had to be something wrong w me so I polled my other mom friends. Nope. Lots of them hate it to and feel the same way. Thank God I got it on sale. Don’t pay full price. It’s great when it works tho.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 32g amazon fire
customer_reviews.text: The quality is good. However, it is not user friendly. I bought this for my 6yo (which is it supposed to be geared for via advertisement). It is not user friendly. The update took 1 hour on wifi. I still can not figure out how to make it look like the advertisement picture with all his games, movies, etc. I don't like to fact my amazon account is connected and he can potential ordered stuff. Any one out there have a step by step tutorial on how to make it so only my 6 yo can use it with parental controls so he doesn't see things he doesn't need to see . I did not by it for adult useage
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tablet for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet. I have one for my 4 yr old and one for my 2 1/2 yr old. It comes with Freetime Unlimited for a year free which is perfect for my kids. It is almost perfect. The whole thing, including the screen freezes from time to time and I have to hold the power button until it shuts off to restart it. It doesn't happen very often. So that aside, it's great!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling with toddlers
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver for us! We had a trip from Chicago to Barcelona (stop in Munich). So, 13 hours of fun times with 2 year old twin boys. We loaded the tablet with movies/games and It occupied our boys for long periods of time. Cons- not easy to install google play store and youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Brusly Singhanath

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Tablet
customer_reviews.text: First off why is the charger so short? I will be contacting Amazon tomorrow, but with in a week of using this they system now crashes and it says error. I then have to restart it and it will work for 10 min maybe and do the same thing. I'm rather annoyed because all my toddler uses it for is Barney and Elmo TV. Thankfully there is the warranty but I've never been so disappointed in an Amazon product before. The yellow case is super cute and durable so two starts for that.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: GET IT - if you are on the fence - don't be!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old. I thought she was probably too young for it, but she was constantly wanting my phone and doing horrible things to my phone. This tablet was a life-saver!! My favorite part - she watches Blippi WITH NO ADS... yup, ad-free, no ability to purchase, just entertainment that I select and that is age appropriate. It's a big screen and easy for her to navigate the buttons and apps. The cover is genius - this thing gets sat on and stepped on and still looks brand new. I've downloaded movies for long car rides & apps/games are also downloaded to the tablet so it can function quite well even when not on WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Please pay attention to the negative reviews here. These things are a total headache. I’ve purchased three over the years and they’ve all lasted less than a year each. The first stopped holding a charge after a year. The second one stopped taking a charge about 6 months in and the third takes over 24 hours of being plugged in to fully charge. These things are a total joke. Too bad the concept is really great, which is why I kept trying. The poor quality of this product leaves me with absolutely no faith in any Amazon branded product. Buy something else!
customer_reviews.author: Jeri

customer_reviews.title: Not very functional
customer_reviews.text: My whole purpose of buying this for my 3 year old was to get him educational games, books etc. At first it worked great and he enjoyed it. As of today he's only had it for one week and it's been kicking him out in the middle of a game, you can't view any downloads (click on a blank square to guess what it is) and audio is playing randomly when nothing is being watched or played. I am disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good purchase for the kids. The biggest obstacle though is the Amazon free time. Having weekend and weekday settings sounds ok, but a little more granularity would be good. Having school night vs not school night would be better. Friday nights I'd be more relaxed with, Sunday nights not so much. Also, the function that only allows the tablet to be fully operative until educational goals is not very functional. Adding content to devices is confusing to me and having more than 1 child profile on the tablet seems to complicate things even more. Tablet itself great, FreeTime, not as much
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: 2 year later review
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tablet. December 10th 2017. It lasted till January 25th 2019. Replaced it no questions asked. Again today December 6th 2019. Replacing no questions asked. Not many other tablets can do that. It is very hard to crack. I believe it took a 7yr old jumping on it. Parental controls are great. Battery life is good. The case is ridiculously good for kids being drop proof. Worth the $80. You know you’ll have a working tablet next 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Southwest Airlines onboard player app not availble on Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Kindle Fire (for my kids) to watch TV and movies on the plane, but it doesn't work! To watch on Southwest Airlines, you have to download the Southwest app from the App Store for iOS or Google Play for Android, but neither are available on the Kindle Fire (without rooting it)! I can understand that Amazon and Google are competitors but we customers shouldn't be made to suffer because we can't access Google apps easily on our Amazon device -- even though Fire OS is a Google Android based operating system and could run them easily. It would be better if Amazon put this Southwest Airlines app and other Androids apps on their Appstore for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: John O

customer_reviews.title: Love it charging port stops charging all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I do have to say I was extremely happy with this purchase at first as my grand daughter absolutely loves loves it..mbut the bad things is in the less than 2 yrs (warentee) I have had to send it back 4 times for the same reason the CHARGING PORT! It will just stop charging and that's the end ..each time they replace it with a new tablet and a few months later it's the same problem..warentee is almost up just had to replace it again. Worried now because its costly at 140.00 to get another and go through this but it's a well loved toy..and I do know there are MANY OF US BUYERS WITH THE SAME PROBLEM !!
customer_reviews.author: tina2367

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we had a refurbished fire 7i used for my son and the battery would drain super fast and only had 8gbs of memory. With this one having can add all the stuff he loves to do.I have that YouTube and Amazon don't see eye to eye so no YouTube kids just an off brand version. Becomes a major factor for that. I do like that they cancelled my primetime subscription and have me a year free so that offsets the other issue. Not sure on battery since I can't measure it since we just got it
customer_reviews.author: Jm

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. Don’t buy it. Get a Leappad or IPad or Samsung tablet or literally anything else. We bought this because we thought being designed for children meant it would be user friendly but it’s so difficult to use!! Even worse, it requires a lock screen pin and if your kid puts in a wrong pin 3 times it locks them out completely for 5 HOURS!!!! WHY SO LONG??! Just one of the many, many, many ridiculous and confusing features of this tablet. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever!!!!! I got the two pack deal for my twins birthday (just turned 10). We drive a lot and these things are fantastic. Full parent controls so they cannot just download anything. I have the controls set to their age, so they can only download age appropriate stuff but nothing else. They love them and the long drives are now dreamy. They have games, jokes, and books. My little girl loves making videos too. I searched for weeks debating what brand and such to get. 100% happy with this purchase. Bought them in August 2019.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: need to get  used to differences from standard tablets
customer_reviews.text: First time with Fire tablet. Own 5 other Android or Apple devices. Pros: Nice looking and great feel. Daughter loves having her own tablet. Good parental controls and curfew feature. Cons: Disappointed at available apps. All of the items that we normally use cannot be done this tablet. Cannot add apps like you can on Android or Apple devices, such as You Tube Kids, ABC Mouse. Unfortunately you have a new operating system to learn. But if your kids grow up only knowing Fire tablets than your fine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Baer

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% kid friendly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my 3 year old. I found looking for tablet complicated and confusing. I went with the fire over leapfrog after reading reviews. I like that my daughter can watch shows offline and that I can download shows for her to watch while on the road. Maybe it’s me but I find this tablet a little complicated to use when it comes to adding apps. Several Of the apps only offer limited useage for free. I did not like that I had to put a lock code on the tablet because my three year old can not unlock it.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. D

customer_reviews.title: Nice but breaks a lot even in case
customer_reviews.text: My kids love their fires but not this one. I don't know if it's the larger screen but the fire 8s break a lot more then the 7s. Save some money and just get a 7. Because each return is harder to place with customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jaz

customer_reviews.title: No screen lock...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I got one of these for our daughter and as much as she loves it, she also hates it with a passion. This is an item for children, yet you can't lock the screen. I shouldn't have to download a thrid party screen locking app just so my daughter can watch a show without accidentally hitting something.
customer_reviews.author: Aletriss

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet for safe dad!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gift. I'm not talking about for my children. FOR ME! Don't get me wrong. My children love it. But for me, it all the parental help that come already installed on the tablet. I mean, I can shut it down if they don't turn them off when I tell them to. Very customizable. It even has a feature that makes it mandatory to spend a certain amount of time on an educational app before going to a game. Now I'm on the hunt for a cell phone or app that I can do the same things for my older children!
customer_reviews.author: The Copelands

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed for the 2nd time
customer_reviews.text: My son is 5 and he uses his tablet everyday to watch netflix, hulu and most recently youtube to help teach him how to draw specific items. He enjoys freetime because of all the educational games...now he is about to be on his 3rd tablet because it stopped charging again. There is suppose to be a worry free 2 year warranty but they are only offering me 15% off. The last tablet was sent to me Dec. 14th 2018 and they say my warranty expired Dec. 16th 2019 😑. I need to find my son a new tablet. I need a reliable one that doesn't just stop charging when it feels like it. I am very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tahaha J.

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE create a child lock screen for videos and fix the dang connection issues!
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. Like, at all. In fact, hate this thing. The connection is constantly dropping which causes more tantrums than this then was supposed to ease. You can’t save videos or shows for later, you always have to re-search all the time. But my absolute least favorite thing is that there is no way to “child lock” the screen. My daughter doesn’t understand yet that if she touches the screen, the show could pause, or exit or whatever else. This thing has caused more problems then it’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: DubbKitty

customer_reviews.title: Hard to limit content
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 3 y/o daughter to use on car trips. It’s not as parent control friendly as other well known screens. Formerly with her iPad, I could download the apps that I approved of and if I didn’t like something, I just deleted it. With the Kindle Free-Time, I cant do that. Instead, I have to go through lists of hundreds of apps and choose which ones I want to block. Every time my daughter uses the Kindle she finds an app that isn’t not appropriate for her that I didn’t even know existed. It’s a lot of hassle to go through and block hundreds of apps instead of just downloading the ones I want.
customer_reviews.author: dog lover

customer_reviews.title: Wait forever to load
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. The games take 10-15 minutes to load, if they load at all. Bought these to go on vacation with, but couldn’t use them for the long car ride. Highly disappointed. Will definitely be returning these when we get back home.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Not for younger kiddos
customer_reviews.text: Terrible for little kids! I can’t freeze the screen like you can Apple products, so my son accidentally pauses and stops his show/movie constantly. I kind of hate this thing! I wish I had just bought him an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: SSHckh

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: we bought this for my 2.5 year old at the time. It was so easy to use! we keep it charged for road trips mostly, but while we are connected to the internet at the house he is able to download games and videos to do while we drive. He cannot get into anything i don't want him to, yet has access to all sorts of games and age appropriate videos. It is so nice to be able to hand it to him and not have to check every 2 minutes if he is on something appropriate or if he has purchased something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OOOPS!! Something went wrong!
customer_reviews.text: 50% of the time the kids apps crashes, I'm quite disappointed that it does this for having a good ram, my phone is the first samsung prime and it never crashes it might be slow but it doesn't crash. I know it can be replaced if it's broken but i think this is something to do with the software. My son can't even watch full episodes of a show that Amazon provided.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Worry free warranty saved us
customer_reviews.text: If you want something you can return after the kids destroy it- id suggest trying these kids fire tablets. Amazon customer service was able to trade out both of our tablets under the two year worry free warranty. They ship the new tablet the day you speak to them, so the kids were able to get on their new tablets within two days . Worth the money. I suggest getting yours on amazon prime day when tablets are half off
customer_reviews.author: J P

customer_reviews.title: Just don’t.
customer_reviews.text: This update has got to be one of the worst decisions a company could make. You cannot sort anything like you can with other manufacturers like apple. Everything is thrown together right there on the home screen and it’s incredibly overwhelming for me as an adult to look at. I can most definitely say this has to be one of the worst tablets for children. Sure, you can put controls on it but for a child who’s learning and doesn’t know how to regulate emotions well it’s a very very poor choice. Autistic parents I’d most definitely steer clear. Nothing about this is organized and for my little thats a huge stressor that can and will cause a meltdown.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria G.

customer_reviews.title: What I wish I had known
customer_reviews.text: I love this kids tablet. Confusing to learn though. I didn’t know my 9 year old could access my account (I thought there was only a kids account on it), and he was able to access the internet through my account. Big warning to parents!! Before giving to your child ensure all parental controls are set up and your adult account is locked 🤦‍♀️ Not blaming the product at all, just my lack of knowledge. Take the extra time to learn the tablet before handing it to your child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Operating System is Limiting
customer_reviews.text: **Edit** Tami from Amazon customer service contacted me about my review. The follow up is much appreciated. This is the last device I purchase from Amazon until the Fire OS environment becomes lest restrictive. The BS about not being able to install apps from the Google store is ridiculous. I have bought and returned several devices from the Fire family hoping that things get better. It simply is never the case. The hardware is great. The parental controls seem to be okay once you get used to them. But that OS!
customer_reviews.author: agoin001

customer_reviews.title: Frequent freezing and errors
customer_reviews.text: When it works it's a great educational tool for our child. However it frequently freezes or shows an error on the screen and needs to be restarted. Some apps that it opened fine just moments before won't open as you sit waiting for it. It's a cheap tablet and at the end of the day, that's exactly what it is.
customer_reviews.author: John J Burns III

customer_reviews.title: Terrible kids product for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Kindle Fire I have purchased and yet again it has stopped working. Everything about this product is not holding up to Amazon standards. We find they stop working after a few short Months. Also there are excessive charges for everything that is supposed to be free and after contacting Amazon who promptly refunds most, it is hard to keep track of every charge and the charging plug breaks every time. The time I guess has lapsed and I can’t even exchange the one just purchased on 1 June 2019. I’m very disappointed with this product. Looking for an alternative now.
customer_reviews.author: phylis mccomb

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought a two pack of these kid tablets for a corporate event at Christmas. We pulled the name of a family with two children who were struggling financially, and they had said the kids asked for some kind of tablets they could use. We found these on a sale and purchased them. My middle son had a Fire and loved it, and my granddaughter has one. They were reasonably priced and a great gift for school age kids. They were in different colors so there is no fighting over whose tablet it is. I can only assume Christmas was a success.
customer_reviews.author: Moonstar

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Works great amazing screen quality and can take a fall
customer_reviews.author: Desarae Otto

customer_reviews.title: My kids love theirs
customer_reviews.text: My kids really like their tablets. They enjoy watching videos, playing games. There’s quite a bit of free apps too. It can be somewhat confusing though as far as some of the settings such as how to mute Alexa because it interferes with the one in the living room. And also, I was told by a rep that kids can get on Google and play videos but I have yet to figure out how. So, with these two hiccups, I’d still recommend these tablets for kids as they’ll never get bored with them. I like the fact it already has the case on them because my kids can be clumsy at times and drop them.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Videos don't work outside of the US!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as a Christmas gift for my godchildren but they have hardly played with it and are constantly harassing their parents for their phones. The problem is that the videos don't work in Jamaica. YouTube works brilliantly but they are too young (4 and 3) to spend time distinguishing between YouTube and what they see as something they want to watch. When they click on a video and get an error message, they get frustrated, so now they just don't want to use it at all!!! This is quite disappointing! Now the touchscreen has stopped working! The tablet is useless.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Freetime SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: Only had the tablet a week before Freetime started freezing constantly. Only way to fix is by restarting the tablet over. Seriously considering sending it back. If Amazon isn't going to fix this issue
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for child
customer_reviews.text: The Fire is just what a child needs. It is reasonably priced and easy to use. There are lots of educational games too, and easy to monitor what the kids are using and when they are using them. We have these for our 5 and 8 year olds and they are more than adequate for what they need.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Arbeene

customer_reviews.title: It won't go flying off if you forget it on top of your vehicle!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a rough day between going to the pediatrician for my son and hunting down equipment for his medicine delivery and his medications. As I was doing all of this, I somehow forgot his tablet on top of the car...where it miraculously stayed for 20 minutes while sped through town, took curves and turns rather quickly and sped over speed bumps. Amazon has my business for life when it comes to this tablet and the case it came with! I'm glad I didn't lose this since it helped keep my son entertained and my sanity during our 5 hours of errands and doctors visits. Definitely recommend this tablet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: kid proof
customer_reviews.text: I brought these for my kids Christmas and they are better and durable than any other tablet I've brought in the past! I can't wait for the kids to open on Christmas day! It was easy to set up and navigate and I love the parent restrictions it offers
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: yuck
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the older version and all the kids LOVE it! So when I saw a newer version I went for it so that they didn't have to fight over just one tablet. I am very disappointed with it. It is so very slow and the apps are so difficult to maneuver through. As an adult, I even put it aside I get so frustrated with it. I even purchased a sim card hoping to speed it up but it is not a tablet that is kid friendly. I should have read the reviews, but I just assumed it would be like the old version. Wish I could trade it for the old one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jackson

product_meta.title: Fire HD 8 Kids Edition Tablet, 8" HD Display, 32 GB, Blue Kid-Proof Case (Previous Generation - 8th)
feature_bullets: Up to $124 in savings on Fire HD 8 tablet, 1 year of Amazon FreeTime Unlimited, and a Kid-Proof Case, versus items purchased separately - plus a 2-year worry-free guarantee

Not a toy, a full-featured Fire HD 8 tablet with a vibrant 8" HD display, 32 GB internal storage, up to 10 hours of battery life, a 1.3 GHz quad-core processor, and 1.5 GB of RAM. Add a microSD card for up to 400 GB of expandable storage.

The included 1 year of FreeTime Unlimited gives your kids access to over 20,000 popular apps and games, videos, books, Audible books, and educational content from PBS Kids, Nickelodeon, Disney, and more. Your subscription will then automatically renew every month starting at just $2.99 per month plus applicable tax. You may cancel at any time by visiting the Amazon Parent Dashboard or contacting Customer Service.
2-year worry-free guarantee: if it breaks, return it and we'll replace it for free.

Introducing Spanish language content in FreeTime Unlimited - kids can now enjoy over 1,000 books, movies, and apps in Spanish that include titles and characters like Sesamo, Dora, Diego, Frozen, and more.

Kids can listen to thousands of hours of fun, educational and inspirational Audible books like Beauty and the Beast, The Snow Queen, Peter Pan, Rip Van Winkle, and more professionally narrated by their favorite characters, authors and celebrities.
Add even more content to your child's profile in FreeTime to give them selected access to apps in your personal library, such as Netflix and Minecraft.

Easy-to-use parental controls allow parents to personalize screen time limits, set educational goals, filter age-appropriate content, and also manage web browsing and content usage. Parental controls can be set on device or online through Amazon Parent Dashboard. Additionally, access all tablet features in the adult profile by entering your passcode.
